result.execSummary:
The defendant Freddie D Manns III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Offender-Fail/Provide Information, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(2)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court costs are waived. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Comply with sex offender registry and sex offender programming.   Firearm warning given. Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 4 years bifurcated sentence.

**AMENDED 5/5/2020:  Court finds defendant eligible for SAP after serving 1 year of initial incarceration.**

superMiscConds.notes: Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent.  Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement.
